date_created.label: Date created
date_created.help_text: The moment when the item was created.

date_modified.label: Date modified
date_modified.help_text: The last moment when the item was modified. A value in year 1750 indicates the value is unknown

docket_number.label: Docket number
docket_number.help_text: The docket number in the lower court.

assigned_to_str.label: Assigned to str
assigned_to_str.help_text: The judge that the case was assigned to, as a string.

ordering_judge_str.label: Ordering judge str
ordering_judge_str.help_text: The judge that issued the final order in the case, as a string.

court_reporter.label: Court reporter
court_reporter.help_text: The court reporter responsible for the case.

date_disposed.label: Date disposed
date_disposed.help_text: The date the case was disposed at the lower court.

date_filed.label: Date filed
date_filed.help_text: The date the case was filed in the lower court.

date_judgment.label: Date judgment
date_judgment.help_text: The date of the order or judgment in the lower court.

date_judgment_eod.label: Date judgment eod
date_judgment_eod.help_text: The date the judgment was Entered On the Docket at the lower court.

date_filed_noa.label: Date filed noa
date_filed_noa.help_text: The date the notice of appeal was filed for the case.

date_received_coa.label: Date received coa
date_received_coa.help_text: The date the case was received at the court of appeals.

assigned_to.label: Assigned to
assigned_to.help_text: The judge the case was assigned to.

ordering_judge.label: Ordering judge
ordering_judge.help_text: The judge that issued the final order in the case.

date_created.label: Date created
date_created.help_text: The moment when the item was created.

date_modified.label: Date modified
date_modified.help_text: The last moment when the item was modified. A value in year 1750 indicates the value is unknown

dataset_source.label: Dataset source
dataset_source.help_text: IDB has several source datafiles. This field helps keep track of where a row came from originally.

choices.display_name: Civil cases filed and terminated from SY 1970 through SY 1987
Civil cases filed, terminated, and pending from SY 1988 to present (2017)
Civil cases filed, terminated, and pending from SY 1988 to present (2020)
Civil cases filed, terminated, and pending from SY 1988 to present (September 2021)
Civil cases filed, terminated, and pending from SY 1988 to present (March 2022)
Criminal defendants filed and terminated from SY 1970 through FY 1995
Criminal defendants filed, terminated, and pending from FY 1996 to present (2017)
Appellate cases filed and terminated from SY 1971 through FY 2007
Appellate cases filed, terminated, and pending from FY 2008 to present (2017)
Bankruptcy cases filed, terminated, and pending from FY 2008 to present (2017)

office.label: Office
office.help_text: The code that designates the office within the district where the case is filed. Must conform with format established in Volume XI, Guide to Judiciary Policies and Procedures, Appendix A. See: https://free.law/idb-facts/

docket_number.label: Docket number
docket_number.help_text: The number assigned by the Clerks' office; consists of 2 digit Docket Year (usually calendar year in which the case was filed) and 5 digit sequence number.

origin.label: Origin
origin.help_text: A single digit code describing the manner in which the case was filed in the district.

choices.display_name: Removed  (began in the state court, removed to the district court)
Remanded for further action (removal from court of appeals)
Reinstated/reopened (previously opened and closed, reopened for additional action)
Transferred from another district(pursuant to 28 USC 1404)
Multi district litigation (cases transferred to this district by an order entered by Judicial Panel on Multi District Litigation pursuant to 28 USC 1407)
Appeal to a district judge of a magistrate judge's decision
Multi district litigation originating in the district (valid beginning July 1, 2016)

date_filed.label: Date filed
date_filed.help_text: The date on which the case was filed in the district.

jurisdiction.label: Jurisdiction
jurisdiction.help_text: The code which provides the basis for the U.S. district court jurisdiction in the case. This code is used in conjunction with appropriate nature of suit code.

nature_of_suit.label: Nature of suit
nature_of_suit.help_text: A three digit statistical code representing the nature of suit of the action filed.

choices.display_name: 153 Recovery of overpayments of vet benefits
462 Naturalization, petition for hearing of denial
899 Administrative procedure act / review or appeal of agency decision
900 Appeal of fee - equal access to justice

diversity_of_residence.label: Diversity of residence
diversity_of_residence.help_text: Involves diversity of citizenship for the plaintiff and defendant. First position is the citizenship of the plaintiff, second position is the citizenship of the defendant. Only used when jurisdiction is 4

class_action.label: Class action
class_action.help_text: Involves an allegation by the plaintiff that the complaint meets the prerequisites of a "Class Action" as provided in Rule 23 - F.R.CV.P.

monetary_demand.label: Monetary demand
monetary_demand.help_text: The monetary amount sought by plaintiff (in thousands). Amounts less than $500 appear as 1, and amounts over $10k appear as 9999. See notes in codebook.

county_of_residence.label: County of residence
county_of_residence.help_text: The code for the county of residence of the first listed plaintiff (see notes in codebook). Appears to use FIPS code.

arbitration_at_filing.label: Arbitration at filing
arbitration_at_filing.help_text: This field is used only by the courts  participating in the Formal Arbitration Program.  It is not used for any other purpose.

multidistrict_litigation_docket_number.label: Multidistrict litigation docket number
multidistrict_litigation_docket_number.help_text: A 4 digit multi district litigation docket number.

plaintiff.label: Plaintiff
plaintiff.help_text: First listed plaintiff. This field appears to be cut off at 30 characters

defendant.label: Defendant
defendant.help_text: First listed defendant. This field appears to be cut off at 30 characters.

date_transfer.label: Date transfer
date_transfer.help_text: The date when the papers were received in the receiving district for a transferred  case.

transfer_office.label: Transfer office
transfer_office.help_text: The office number of the district losing the case.

transfer_docket_number.label: Transfer docket number
transfer_docket_number.help_text: The docket number of the case in the losing district

transfer_origin.label: Transfer origin
transfer_origin.help_text: The origin number of the case in the losing district

date_terminated.label: Date terminated
date_terminated.help_text: The date the district court received the final judgment or the order disposing of the case.

termination_class_action_status.label: Termination class action status
termination_class_action_status.help_text: A code that indicates a case involving allegations of class action.

procedural_progress.label: Procedural progress
procedural_progress.help_text: The point to which the case had progressed when it was disposed of. See notes in codebook.

choices.display_name: Request for trial de novo after arbitration

disposition.label: Disposition
disposition.help_text: The manner in which the case was disposed of.

nature_of_judgement.label: Nature of judgement
nature_of_judgement.help_text: Cases disposed of by an entry of a final judgment.

amount_received.label: Amount received
amount_received.help_text: Dollar amount received (in thousands) when appropriate. Field not used uniformally; see codebook.

judgment.label: Judgment
judgment.help_text: Which party the cases was disposed in favor of.

pro_se.label: Pro se
pro_se.help_text: Which parties filed pro se? (See codebook for more details.)

choices.display_name: No pro se plaintiffs or defendants
Pro se plaintiffs, but no pro se defendants
Pro se defendants, but no pro se plaintiffs

year_of_tape.label: Year of tape
year_of_tape.help_text: Statistical year label on data files obtained from the Administrative Office of the United States Courts.  2099 on pending case records.

nature_of_offense.label: Nature of offense
nature_of_offense.help_text: The four digit D2 offense code associated with the filing title/secion 1. These codes were created in FY2005 to replace the AO offense codes.

choices.display_name: Embezzlement: Officer or Employee of U.S. Govt.
National Defense, Illegal Use of Uniform
Eight Hour Day on Public Works

version.label: Version
version.help_text: This field was created in FY 2012. It increments with each update received to a defendant record.

circuit.label: Circuit
circuit.help_text: Circuit in which the case was filed.

district.label: District
district.help_text: District court in which the case was filed.

date_created.label: Date created
date_created.help_text: The moment when the item was created.

date_modified.label: Date modified
date_modified.help_text: The last moment when the item was modified. A value in year 1750 indicates the value is unknown

source.label: Source
source.help_text: contains the source of the Docket.

appeal_from_str.label: Appeal from str
appeal_from_str.help_text: In appellate cases, this is the lower court or administrative body where this case was originally heard. This field is frequently blank due to it not being populated historically. This field may have values when the appeal_from field does not. That can happen if we are unable to normalize the value in this field.

assigned_to_str.label: Assigned to str
assigned_to_str.help_text: The judge that the case was assigned to, as a string.

referred_to_str.label: Referred to str
referred_to_str.help_text: The judge that the case was referred to, as a string.

panel_str.label: Panel str
panel_str.help_text: The initials of the judges on the panel that heard this case. This field is similar to the 'judges' field on the cluster, but contains initials instead of full judge names, and applies to the case on the whole instead of only to a specific decision.

date_last_index.label: Date last index
date_last_index.help_text: The last moment that the item was indexed in Solr.

date_cert_granted.label: Date cert granted
date_cert_granted.help_text: date cert was granted for this case, if applicable

date_cert_denied.label: Date cert denied
date_cert_denied.help_text: the date cert was denied for this case, if applicable

date_argued.label: Date argued
date_argued.help_text: the date the case was argued

date_reargued.label: Date reargued
date_reargued.help_text: the date the case was reargued

date_reargument_denied.label: Date reargument denied
date_reargument_denied.help_text: the date the reargument was denied

date_filed.label: Date filed
date_filed.help_text: The date the case was filed.

date_terminated.label: Date terminated
date_terminated.help_text: The date the case was terminated.

date_last_filing.label: Date last filing
date_last_filing.help_text: The date the case was last updated in the docket, as shown in PACER's Docket History report or iquery page.

case_name_short.label: Case name short
case_name_short.help_text: The abridged name of the case, often a single word, e.g. 'Marsh'

case_name.label: Case name
case_name.help_text: The standard name of the case

case_name_full.label: Case name full
case_name_full.help_text: The full name of the case

slug.label: Slug
slug.help_text: URL that the document should map to (the slug)

docket_number.label: Docket number
docket_number.help_text: The docket numbers of a case, can be consolidated and quite long. In some instances they are too long to be indexed by postgres and we store the full docket in the correction field on the Opinion Cluster.

docket_number_core.label: Docket number core
docket_number_core.help_text: For federal district court dockets, this is the most distilled docket number available. In this field, the docket number is stripped down to only the year and serial digits, eliminating the office at the beginning, letters in the middle, and the judge at the end. Thus, a docket number like 2:07-cv-34911-MJL becomes simply 0734911. This is the format that is provided by the IDB and is useful for de-duplication types of activities which otherwise get messy. We use a char field here to preserve leading zeros.

federal_dn_office_code.label: Federal dn office code
federal_dn_office_code.help_text: A one digit statistical code (either alphabetic or numeric) of the office within the federal district. In this example, 2:07-cv-34911-MJL, the 2 preceding the : is the office code.

federal_dn_case_type.label: Federal dn case type
federal_dn_case_type.help_text: Case type, e.g., civil (cv), magistrate (mj), criminal (cr), petty offense (po), and miscellaneous (mc). These codes can be upper case or lower case, and may vary in number of characters.

federal_dn_judge_initials_assigned.label: Federal dn judge initials assigned
federal_dn_judge_initials_assigned.help_text: A typically three-letter upper cased abbreviation of the judge's initials. In the example 2:07-cv-34911-MJL, MJL is the judge's initials. Judge initials change if a new judge takes over a case.

federal_dn_judge_initials_referred.label: Federal dn judge initials referred
federal_dn_judge_initials_referred.help_text: A typically three-letter upper cased abbreviation of the judge's initials. In the example 2:07-cv-34911-MJL-GOG, GOG is the magistrate judge initials.

federal_defendant_number.label: Federal defendant number
federal_defendant_number.help_text: A unique number assigned to each defendant in a case, typically found in pacer criminal cases as a -1, -2 after the judge initials. Example: 1:14-cr-10363-RGS-1.

pacer_case_id.label: Pacer case id
pacer_case_id.help_text: The case ID provided by PACER.

nature_of_suit.label: Nature of suit
nature_of_suit.help_text: The nature of suit code from PACER.

jurisdiction_type.label: Jurisdiction type
jurisdiction_type.help_text: Stands for jurisdiction in RECAP XML docket. For example, 'Diversity', 'U.S. Government Defendant'.

appellate_fee_status.label: Appellate fee status
appellate_fee_status.help_text: The status of the fee in the appellate court. Can be used as a hint as to whether the government is the appellant (in which case the fee is waived).

appellate_case_type_information.label: Appellate case type information
appellate_case_type_information.help_text: Information about a case from the appellate docket in PACER. For example, 'civil, private, bankruptcy'.

mdl_status.label: Mdl status
mdl_status.help_text: The MDL status of a case before the Judicial Panel for Multidistrict Litigation

filepath_ia.label: Filepath ia
filepath_ia.help_text: Path to the Docket XML page in The Internet Archive

filepath_ia_json.label: Filepath ia json
filepath_ia_json.help_text: Path to the docket JSON page in the Internet Archive

ia_upload_failure_count.label: Ia upload failure count
ia_upload_failure_count.help_text: Number of times the upload to the Internet Archive failed.

ia_needs_upload.label: Ia needs upload
ia_needs_upload.help_text: Does this item need to be uploaded to the Internet Archive? I.e., has it changed? This field is important because it keeps track of the status of all the related objects to the docket. For example, if a related docket entry changes, we need to upload the item to IA, but we can't easily check that.

ia_date_first_change.label: Ia date first change
ia_date_first_change.help_text: The moment when this item first changed and was marked as needing an upload. Used for determining when to upload an item.

date_blocked.label: Date blocked
date_blocked.help_text: The date that this opinion was blocked from indexing by search engines

blocked.label: Blocked
blocked.help_text: Whether a document should be blocked from indexing by search engines

appeal_from.label: Appeal from
appeal_from.help_text: In appellate cases, this is the lower court or administrative body where this case was originally heard. This field is frequently blank due to it not being populated historically or due to our inability to normalize the value in appeal_from_str.

parent_docket.label: Parent docket
parent_docket.help_text: In criminal cases (and some magistrate) PACER creates a parent docket and one or more child dockets. Child dockets contain docket information for each individual defendant while parent dockets are a superset of all docket entries.

tags.label: Tags
tags.help_text: The tags associated with the docket.

panel.label: Panel
panel.help_text: The empaneled judges for the case. Currently an unused field but planned to be used in conjunction with the panel_str field.
